Utilities package¶

Module contents¶

class Utilities.Positions[source]¶

Positions enum class with quarterback, running_back, kicker, defense, wide_receiver, and tight_end

static get_positions()[source]¶
Returns:a dictionary containing the enum and the string representation of each position.
class Utilities.StatType[source]¶

StatType enum class with playerInfo, statistics, playerWeekly, weather, injury, games, teams, and byes.

Utilities.convert_to_24(time)[source]¶

A function to convert from meridiem time(AM/PM) to universal time (24 hour).

Parameters:time – A string representation of the time in 12 hour form. Ex. ‘11:00 AM’
Returns:A string representation of the time in 24 hour format.
Utilities.get_current_season()[source]¶

An optional getter function. Currently this method is not very useful, because it just returns the value of a global variable, but future refactoring will encapsulate the current season attribute.

Return int:The current nfl season. The default value is 2010.
Utilities.get_current_week()[source]¶

An optional getter function. Currently this method is not very useful, because it just returns the value of a global variable, but future refactoring will encapsulate the current week attribute.

Return int:The current week in the nfl season. The default value is 1.
Utilities.log(message, outfile='./log.txt')[source]¶

A simple logging function that prepends a timestamp to message and writes it to outfile.

Parameters:
  • message – a string containing the message to be printed to outfile.
  • outfile – A string with the absolute path to a file to be written to.
Utilities.log_exception(e, log_file)[source]¶

A simple logging function that prepends a timestamp to the provided exception type and exception arguments. It is then written it to outfile.

Parameters:
  • e – An exception object.
  • log_file – A string with the absolute path to a file to be written to.
Utilities.update_season(new_season)[source]¶

An optional setter function for the current_season global variable. While not required, the use of this function is preferred because it tests the input for basic validity. Future refactoring with transform the underling global variable into a class property.

Return int:The new nfl season if new_season is a valid update
Return int:-1 otherwise
Utilities.update_week(new_week)[source]¶

An optional setter function for the current_week global variable. While not required, the use of this function is preferred because it tests the input for basic validity. Future refactoring with transform the underling global variable into a class property.

Return int:The new week if new_week is a valid update. I.E. new_week` is an int s.t. 1 <= new_week` <= 17
Return int:-1 otherwise
